lead_paragraph: AS long as employers have wanted to check up on job applicants, an industry of tiny background-checking companies has existed, prowling courthouses to check criminal records and working the phones to verify employment and education. Driven by post-Sept. 11 wariness and the spread of public databases that enables more efficient checking from distant locations, the industry is now rapidly consolidating. A handful of national companies is bulking up by buying smaller competitors, seeking dominance in a business expected to double in sales over the next five years to $4 billion.

headline.main: As Background Checks Get Big, The Little Guys Get Bigger

snippet: Does the little guy stand a chance in the background-checking buisness? The answer appears to be yes, with enough capital and some smart investments in technology.
